title: Flawed Unemployment Stats Don’t Fool Wall Street, So Stock Market Rise Will Continue
text: Unemployment is an area where Wall Street understanding overrides media headlines

title: Expect the US dollar to weaken over the medium-term: Fitch
text: Nicolas Sopel of Fitch Solutions highlights the 0.95 level on the U.S. Dollar Index as an inflection point for a weakening greenback and a sign of long and uneven recovery.

title: Hang Seng to Launch New Index Tracking H.K.’s Tech Stocks
text: Vincent Kwan, chief executive officer at Hang Seng Indexes Company, discusses the launch of a new index tracking Hong Kong’s 30 biggest tech stocks and the significance of the new index.

title: Gold eyes record high as safe-haven demand thrives
text: Gold prices extended gains on Monday, just $3 shy of an all-time high, driven by U.S.-China tensions and a weaker dollar, while expectations of more stimulus to revive pandemic-hit economies lifted the metal's appeal as an inflation hedge.

title: Silver Rally: Next Stop $27?
text: Silver is finally waking up from a long bear market and multi-year slumber. Gold kick-started the precious metals rally and finally Silver is following suit… and perhaps even leading.

title: Dollar to Fall Quite a Bit in Coming Months: AxiCorp’s Innes
text: Stephen Innes, chief market strategist at AxiCorp, discusses his call on the U.S. dollar and his outlook for gold. He speaks on “Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia.”

title: Oil slips as rising coronavirus cases, U.S.-China tensions weigh on markets
text: Oil prices edged down on Monday as rising coronavirus cases and tensions between the United States and China pushed investors toward safe-haven assets.

title: Global stocks on defensive as U.S.-China tensions spook investors
text: U.S. stock futures slipped and Asian shares came under pressure in early Monday trade as tit-for-tat consulate closures in China and the United States fanned worries about worsening diplomatic ties between the world's two largest economies.

title: 'Make Or Break': Stock Market Update For The Week Ahead
text: What Happened: Stocks closed the week lower on an escalation of U.S. and China tensions, mixed reactions to earnings results, and delays in stimulus talks.

title: U.S. stock futures about flat ahead of big earnings week
text: U.S. stock index futures were little changed late Sunday, ahead of a busy earnings week.

title: Stock futures rise slightly ahead of big week of earnings, coronavirus stimulus in focus
text: U.S. stock futures rose on Sunday night as investors braced for a big week of corporate earnings and lawmakers continued coronavirus stimulus negotiations.

title: Summer's most profitable groups in crosshairs of new economic headwinds, money manager Jeff Mills warns
text: Due to the country's coronavirus surge, Bryn Mawr's Jeff Mills predicts economic setbacks will start to meaningfully impact some of the summer's most profitable market groups.

title: If Closing In On Coronavirus ‘Herd Immunity’, Markets Are Mispriced
text: The coronavirus keeps spreading, and hospitals around the world are still feeling the strain. When does it end?

title: Depression-Era Returns Await Balanced Portfolios
text: Returns on a balanced portfolio of U.S. stocks and government bonds are likely to be negative over the next 10 years, underperforming those seen during the Great Depression.

title: Why reinvesting dividends is better than timing markets: Strategist
text: The Oxford Club's Chief Income Strategist Marc Lichtenfeld joins Yahoo Finance’s On The Move panel to break down why investors should focus on dividends.

title: Trump Officials Float Idea of Narrow Bill to Extend Unemployment Benefits
text: The proposal on the eve of Republicans’ unveiling of a larger aid bill amounts to a concession that the two parties are unlikely to reach a deal before benefits expire.

title: Momentum Stocks: Look Out Below
text: The Growth/Tech trade is showing signs of faltering after this past week.

title: Coronavirus stimulus: What needs to get done in the next round
text: Raymond James Washington Policy Analyst Ed Mills joins Yahoo Finance’s Akiko Fujita to discuss the latest developments on another stimulus package in Congress.

title: Republicans to include $1,200 checks and smaller federal unemployment aid in new stimulus proposal
text: White House officials and Senate Republicans are finalizing a bill that would offer $1,200 checks to many Americans and that would not renew the full unemployment insurance enhancement as part of a proposal for the next stimulus bill set to be unveiled Monday, several top administration officials said Sunday.

title: Just A Tech Pullback Or More?
text: Selling last week was focused on the technology and biotech stocks, as the Nasdaq 100 Index ($NDX) was down 1.5%, while the S&P 500 was down just 0.3%. Unemployment data has caused some worry among analysts but what does that mean as we head into August?

title: Predictions Of The Dollar's Demise Are Likely Premature
text: Predictions of the dollar's demise are likely premature and overblown.

title: Pelosi Criticizes Stimulus Proposal Giving Workers 70% Of Their Wages
text: The House Speaker did, however, support a flat payment—as opposed to pegging them to each worker’s lost wages.

title: Existing home sales climbed a record 20.7% in June
text: Yahoo Finance's Alexis Christoforous and Brian Sozzi break down the existing-home sales numbers for June with Cortland Chief Economist Brad Dillman.

title: Fed Stimulus Has Created The 'Cobra Effect'
text: The market had remained within a consolidation range since the mid-June highs.

title: Trump Officials Say Unemployment Payments Are Priority For Stimulus Package
text: “The trick here is going back to work.”

title: Kudlow says coronavirus relief will include $1,200 checks and extension of eviction moratorium
text: White House economic advisor Larry Kudlow said Sunday that the next round of coronavirus relief will include $1,200 stimulus payments to Americans and said the Trump administration will lengthen the federal eviction moratorium.

title: Why banks may be on the verge of collapse...and we could go into a deep recession: Former FDIC Chair
text: Volcker Alliance Director and former Federal Deposit Insurance Corp.

title: Weekly Commentary: Crossing Red Lines
text: COVID stimulus stoked bubble dynamics for global risk assets, certainly including Chinese equities. This bubble has turned unstable. Chinese stocks reversed sharply lower after the U.S.'s shocking closure of China's Houston consulate.

title: Will the Coronavirus Change ESG Investing?
text: By Salvatore J. Bruno, Chief Investment Officer and Managing Director, IndexIQ It’s hard not to notice that the air has been a little cleaner, the night skies a little brighter.

title: Here are five charts illustrating U.S. economic trends amid the coronavirus pandemic (July 26)
text: These five charts illustrate trends in important industries that help track reopening progress in the U.S. amid the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Another Bear Market Indicator Just Fired. What To Do About It.
text: While everyone is looking at the stock market, the bond market has something to say.

title: The biggest tech earnings matter more than ever
text: The biggest US tech companies have led a spectacular rebound in the stock market, but their recent earnings indicate tech isn't a surefire bet.

title: Gold Is Within Striking Distance of Its All-Time High. Here’s How to Play the Rally
text: By Frank Holmes, CEO and CIO, U.S. Global Investors The time has come.

title: Opportunities in High Yield Remain as Spreads Approach Historical Averages
text: By Adam Schrier, CFA, FRM, Director, Product Management, New York Life Investments U.S. high yield spreads reached 1087 bps on March 23 after hovering between 350-400 bps for the first six weeks of the year.

title: Will The Gold Price Crash Or Shine This Week?
text: Gold prices are within a whisker distance of touching the record high of $1,921, last witnessed in 2011.

title: EU bailout shows the meaning of ‘union’: powerful members helping out the weak
text: Back in May, critics of the EU gleefully pounced on news that the German constitutional court had ruled unlawful the European Central Bank’s plans to flood the financial system with cheap credit.

title: Weighing The Week Ahead: Time To Look Under The Hood
text: Economic data continues to show modest improvement.

title: Let's Make A Deal
text: Jobless claims rose last week for the first time since March - there are over 16 million who filed for ongoing benefits last week.
